FuncDef:
The differential-delay command sets the maximum link differential delay for an IMA group.
The undo differential-delay command restores the default setting.
By default, the maximum link differential delay between member links in an IMA group is 25 ms.

ParaDef.Info:
Sets the maximum link differential delay for an IMA group.
The value is an integer ranging from 25 to 120, in milliseconds.

ExtraInfo:
Usage Scenario
An IMA group is a logical link that consists of one or more physical links. It provides more bandwidth than a single link. The bandwidth of the logical link is approximately equal to the sum of the bandwidth of all member links. Datagrams in an IMA group consist of those from member links.
Link differential delay is the difference of delays for sending packets along member links in an IMA group. To set the maximum link differential delay for an IMA group, run the differential-delay command. The difference of delays for sending datagrams along member links in an IMA group must be less than or equal to the value configured using this command.
To improve bandwidth usage of IMA channels and prevent empty packets from consuming bandwidth, set a smaller maximum link differential delay when traffic is heavy on the network.
Precautions
Configuring the differential-delay command interrupts traffic over member links in an IMA group. After you configure this command, the IMA group renegotiates and reestablishes IMA links.
